availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born in Breckenridge county November 27, 1814. Attended a Louisville school run by Cissell and Hanover. Married to Mary W. Hamilton Williams. Father of Hamilton Williams, Ione Williams Baker, James Russell Williams, Mary Ruth Williams Crutcher, and Hugh A. Williams. Owned four enslaved persons in 1850 and eight in 1860. Moved to Helena, Arkansas in 1837. to teach school. Entered office of Thompson and Boone as law student in 1838. Admitted to the bar in 1840 and opened his law practice in Hawesville. Served as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1850. Served as a district elector for James Buchanan's presidential ticket in 1856. Member of the Whig Party and Democratic Party. Died September 29, 1890 in Owensboro, Davies County, Kentucky.

bibl.p: H. Levin, The Lawyers and Lawmakers of Kentucky (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1897), 319-322; An Illustrated Historical Atlas of Daviess County, Ky. : carefully compiled from personal examinations and surveys (Utica: Leo McDonough & Co., 1876); Tallaferro P. Shaffner, ed., Kentucky Annual State Register, 1847 (Louisville: Morton and Griswold, 1847), 93; Find A Grave, "George Washington WIlliams (November 27, 1814 - September 29, 1890)," Memorial #57361824, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=57361824&ref=acom (accessed June 27, 2017).; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 40; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 3; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Davies County, 1st Ward City of Owensboro, p. 257; Collinsâ€™ Historical Sketches of Kentucky: History of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Collins & Company, 1878), 305;
